name: Parkit - Smart Indoor Parking System
description: A smart IoT-powered indoor parking solution integrating a mobile app with embedded sensors and cloud database to enable real-time parking management.
details: Developed as a capstone project, Parkit integrates Raspberry Pi hardware, various sensors (BME680, VL53L1X, RFID), and Firebase to manage parking slots. It allows users to book, cancel, and access parking spaces securely via NFC, while owners can monitor availability, occupancy, and user profiles. The project featured modular hardware design, mobile app development, secure database integration, and sustainability measures.
features: Real-time parking slot availability and updates
Mobile app integration with booking, NFC-based access
Secure authentication using Firebase and RFID modules
Modular, sustainable, and upgradeable hardware design
lessons: End-to-end IoT system design and deployment
Secure and real-time data handling with Firebase
Hardware-software integration challenges
Unit and production testing strategies
Sustainable product design using modular components
Effective collaboration and project documentation

name: Advanced Enterprise Network Lab
description: A comprehensive enterprise network simulation showcasing the use of Cisco devices and protocols for real-world networking scenarios.
details: This project simulates an enterprise-level network environment using Cisco Packet Tracer, featuring a fully configured network that includes routers, switches, VLANs, routing protocols, ACLs, and security measures. The goal was to design and deploy a secure, segmented, and efficient network for a growing enterprise with multiple departments and remote locations.
features: Access Control Lists (ACLs) for Enhanced Security
Dynamic and Static Routing Protocols (OSPF, RIP, EIGRP)
Subnetting for Efficient IP Address Management
WAN Simulation using Serial Links and PPP
Remote Access VPN for Secure Connectivity
Network Address Translation (NAT) for Internet Access
technologies: WAN Technologies (PPP, Frame Relay, and more)
lessons: Learned to design and implement VLANs for network segmentation.
Configured advanced routing protocols for optimal network routing.
Mastered IP subnetting, including variable-length subnet masking (VLSM).
Implemented security protocols using ACLs to restrict unauthorized access.
Gained hands-on experience in WAN technologies like PPP and Frame Relay.
Designed and deployed secure VPN solutions for remote access.
Configured DHCP servers and NAT for IP address allocation and internet access.
Understood how to troubleshoot and optimize enterprise networks.
